Legal_Issue: Did the visa officer improperly assess the applicant's qualifications for permanent residence under the Immigration Act?
Evidence_Assessment: Visa officer failed to evaluate the applicant's work experience in the designated occupation (5133-126) or provide adequate reasons for refusal
Burden_of_Proof: On the applicant to demonstrate improper assessment
Legal_Rule: Visa officers must thoroughly and fairly assess applicants' qualifications, including alternate occupations inherent in their work experience
Procedural_Issue: Lack of adequate reasoning and failure to assess relevant work experience
Grounds_for_Claim: Misclassification of occupation: 'Managing Supervisor, Retail Store' vs. claimed 'Sales Representative, Office Machines'
Outcome_on_Merits: The visa officer's decision is set aside
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Failure to conduct fair and thorough assessment
Applicant_Challenge: Denial of permanent residence due to occupational misclassification
Court_Result: Reassessment ordered by a different visa officer
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence of work experience, job classification records
Remedy_Requested: Quash the visa officer's decision and direct proper assessment
Outcome: Decision set aside; new assessment required
Legal_Provision: Sections of the Immigration Act relating to permanent residence qualifications
Governing_Rule: Visa officers must fairly assess all relevant work experience and provide transparent reasoning
